newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Oriental Metals surges to record high.
newsitem.headline: Oriental Metals surges to record high.

text.p: Oriental Metals (Holdings) Co Ltd said on Tuesday it was unaware of any reasons for the surge in its stock to record levels.
Oriental Metals shares rose to a high of HK$2.60 on Tuesday before finishing at HK$2.245, up HK$0.175 or 7.7 percent.
Turnover was 26.17 million shares worth HK$64.65 million.
The shares gained 17.8 percent to HK$2.25 on Monday.

Other than an agreement announced on January 15 -- under which ONFEM Holdings Ltd would sell a 40 percent stake in Oriental Metals to ONFEM parent China Nonferrous Metals Holdings (Hong Kong) Ltd -- Oriental Metals said there were no discloseable negotiations or agreements relating to intended acquisitions that were price sensitive.

"We have noted the recent increases in the prices and the trading volume of the shares of the company and wish to state that we are not aware of any reasons for such (an) increase," Oriental Metals said in a statement.
Brokers said speculators were buying the stock on vague hopes that China Nonferrous Metals would inject valuable assets into Oriental Metals once it gets direct control of the firm.
